intro: Hypoestes stenoptera, commonly known as the "Snowflake" plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, brightly colored, showy bracts that resemble small flowers. The plant produces small, tubular, white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers bright, indirect light, making it a popular choice for indoor gardening. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its ability to bloom throughout the year under proper care.
